page.title: 07LANDSCAPE TUNSTALL `SCOBO'
page.content: In Tunstall next to Brownhills High School is an area which is knicknamed Â£Scobo'.This used to be part of an old railway sidings,but the rails have gone and the land has been reclaimed. In Scobo there is a sewer,there are three bridges over this.There are pathways leading to the school,and there is a fishing pond.By the pond there are two old lamposts,and benches.One pathway leads to a tunnel which goes to Westport Lake. Scobo is used for walking and fishing,it is part of what is called the Â£Greenway' which is a series of paths which are reclaimed land in Stoke-on-Trent,and has gained national and international fame.
